5.heading: Pib Press.
5.title: Pibgorn : the Girl in the Coffee Cup
5.author: Brooke McEldowney.
notes: Originally appeared in the online feature Pibgorn, distributed by United Feature Syndicate, Inc.

Summary (from www.thewebcomiclist.com via SkyRiver): "Pibgorn follows the epic saga of its eponymous, fairy heroine as she blunders into and out of danger, magic spells, maledictions, love, hate, rivalry, loyalty, trust, friendship and lousy hair days. Anesthetic to rules and regulations, oblivious to the paths her world long ago blazed for her, Pibgorn streaks through the welkin in hot pursuit of what lies beyond being a mere fairy."

51.heading: Picador.
51.title: The Gigantic Beard that was Evil
51.author: Stephen Collins.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 23 cm.
"Winner of the inaugural 9th Art Award."

"On the island of Here, livin's easy. Conduct is orderly. Lawns are neat. Citizens are clean shaven, and Dave is the most fastidious of them all. Dave is bald, but for a single hair. He loves drawing, his desk job, and the Bangles. But on one fateful day, his life is upended by an unstoppable (yet pretty impressive) beard."

52.heading: Picador USA.
52.title: The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay : a Novel
52.author: Michael Chabon.
notes: Fiction about the comics industry.

53.heading: Picador USA.
53.title: The Buddha Book : a Novel
53.author: Abraham Rodriguez.
notes: Summary (from publisher website): Dinky, Jose, and Barbara are teens living in the Bronx. Dinky wants to put his father's drug dealing reputation behind him Jose has just been dumped by his girlfriend who's moved on to the neighborhood's new drug dealer, Angel Barbara's the smart girl who desperately wants to be noticed. Secretly, Dinky and Jose draw, write, and distribute "Buddha Book," a comic of outrageous tales based on their life in the Bronx. Things change suddenly when, in a fit of rage, Jose murders his ex. Jose wants to turn himself in. But Dinky convinces him that he's committed the perfect crime and would be in great danger if Angel were to discover the real story. The Buddha Book follows Jose as he moves toward acknowledgement of what he has done and finds a way to confess it details Dinky's escape from the clutches of his father to begin a new life and traces Barbara's first steps toward becoming a woman. Lyric, inspired, and darkly funny, The Buddha Book is a powerful novel that brilliantly evokes teenagers at war with themselves and with the place in which they live.

54.heading: Picador USA.
54.title: Derby Dugan's Depression Funnies : a Novel
54.author: by Tom De Haven.
notes: (Picador USA)

Summary: The 1930s world of comic strips through the eyes of Al Beady, a lightning-fast pulp fiction writer. He writes text for "Derby Dugan," a strip on an orphan boy and his smart-aleck talking dog, serving as comic relief for hard times.
Frontispiece by Art Spiegelman.

66.heading: Picard, Caroline.
66.title: "The Jungle Book"
66.author: Rudyard Kipling, art/adaptation by Caroline Picard
66.appears_in: p. 277-284 in The Graphic Canon of Children's Literature (New York : Seven Stories Press, 2014).

67.heading: Picard, Jean-Luc, 2305-
67.title: Beginnings
67.author: written by Mike Carlin ; pencils by Pablo Marcos.
notes: (Star Trek Classics ; 4)
"Originally published by DC Comics as Star Trek: The Next Generation Issues #1-6."

Summary (from SkyRiver): During their earliest voyages, Picard, Riker, Data, Worf, Troi, Yar, and Laforge learn about each other and encounter a de-powered Q who seeks refuge aboard the Enterprise as he attempts to learn what it means to be mortal, a world where warriors see battle as a child's game, and a world with dark secrets which threaten both the ship and the crew.

68.heading: Picard, Jean-Luc, 2305-
68.title: Enemy Unseen.
68.author: [No author]
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Star Trek Classics ; 2)

"Originally published by Wildstorm Productions as Star Trek: The next generation: Perchance to dream issues #1-4, Star Trek: The next generation: Embrace the wolf, and Star Trek: The next generation: The killing shadows issues #1-4."
Summary (from SkyRiver): Captain Jean-Luc Picard and his crew face the most dangerous kind of enemy, the enemy unseen.

69.heading: Picard, Jean-Luc, 2305-
69.title: Star Trek the Next Generation : Mirror Broken
69.author: written by David Tipton & Scott Tipton ; art by J
69.appears_in: K. Woodward ; colors by J.K. Woodward (issue #1), Charlie Kirchoff (issues #2-5) ; letters by AndWorld Design.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
"Originally published as Star Trek: the next generation
Mirror broken issues #0-5."

Summary (from OCLC): One hundred years after an accident with the dimensional barrier introduced four shipmates to an alternate universe, the sinister members of that universe discover a doorway into Picard's time, and plot to replace his Enterprise with theirs.

70.heading: Picard, Jean-Luc, 2305-
70.title: Star Trek, the Next Generation/Doctor Who : Assimilation²
70.author: written by Scott & David Tipton, with Tony Lee ; art by J
70.appears_in: K. Woodward ; additional art by Gordon Purcell and The Sharp Bros.

contents.author: Doctor Who: Assimilation issues #1-8.
contents.title: Originally published as Star Trek: the Next Generation

notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 29 cm.

Summary (from SkyRiver): Captain Jean-Luc Picard and the crew of the USS Enterprise have joined forces with the Doctor and his companions to combat an unholy alliance between the Federation's most terrifying enemy and one of the Doctor's greatest antagonists.
